page.title: 15TREVELGUE HEAD
page.content: It was found that first a trench was dug, then flat blocks were put in the trench at right angles to the sides. This trench was then filled with anything that was at hand-mainly rubbish, such as bones, sand and pebbles. They were then build up to enormous sizes. There were also several smelting holes found -along with many pieces of slag, particularly in the ramparts. The finds made by Croft Andrews are apparently scattered across Britain some being in Truro Museum, the others are supposedly in Croft Andrew's own private collection in Yorkshire.Trevelgue is thought to be one of the most important Iron Age site in Cornwall.
